job_title: Human Resources Generalist in Saint Albans, VT
pros:
I started working at NCSS in the midst of the COVID-19 global pandemic. My interviews were held over video conference, and my first tour through the agency was conducted with face masks and 6 feet social distancing in mind. But this was no cause for Northwestern Counseling and Support Services to stray from their values. On my first day, every single person greeted me with a smile. 

When I say everyone greeted me with a smile, I mean it. And it didn’t stop there. To this day, no matter what hall, building, or county I am in, every single person greets me with a smile. This attests to the kindness, compassion, and professionalism that all NCSS employees embody. I am happy, and proud, to say that I am a part of the NCSS family.
cons: Not that I can think of :)

pros: Work with good people for a good cause
cons: Good luck getting a reasonable wage

pros: NCSS is a supportive and collaborative team. I love this organization
cons: More PAT would be great but there’s a ton of paid holiday time off.

job_title: Service Coordinator in Saint Albans, VT
pros: Good place to work, wonderful team
cons: A quickly growing agency, with a large area that needs to be staffed.

pros: Great clinical staff - committed to providing excellent care
cons: Management is untrustworthy, more concerned with "telling the story" than telling the truth. I can't count the number of times I caught directors telling lies.

job_title: Residential Crisis Bed Support Staff in Saint Albans, VT
pros: Overtime is available, work a job that helps people. Clients are appreciative
cons: Senior Management has no idea how to lead. They will tell you in orientation that they "support employees" they do not. Higher management is out of touch with client care. My experience was NCSS does not care about their employees well being, they do not appreciate employees going over and beyond and they do not put client care first. Advocating for clients will not be heard or even acknowledged. The turnover rate is very high. I would not recommend anyone to work this job.

review_title: Amazing place to start a career, Even better place to grow
pros:
great co-workers
opportunities for growth and personal/professional development
Continual improvements for employee wellness
cons: NCSS has barriers to paying it's staff the salaries they deserve. There are inconsistencies between divisions that can lead to resentment. Also, retention is difficult for this field and although NCSS is working really hard on strategies for employee wellness, there is still more that can be done.

job_title: Community Support Specialist in Saint Albans, VT
pros: NCSS has a solid team environment. I've always felt supported by my supervisor, and director. The benefits package is great as well.
cons: There are sometimes long hours. The position requires us to drive long distances, typically late in the evening. The company does not support vehicle maintenance.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Albans, VT
pros: Great work life balance. Exec. Dir. was open to new ideas. Overall, supportive leadership team and most staff were welcoming and willing to help.
cons: More professional development opportunities would help folks in their careers. More opportunity for advancement.

job_title: Behavior Interventionist in Saint Albans, VT
pros: Competitive pay, great co workers, challenging but amazing clients
cons: Administration doesn't care much about what happens at Soar, definitely effects moral, their ability to recognize problem employees is subpar while they criticize their good employees constantly.

pros: Co workers were all very pleasant
cons: I thought they pay was too low
